title: Air Canada Flight Attendants Strike, 600+ Flights Canceled Amid Wage Dispute
snippets: More than 10,000 Air Canada flight attendants went on strike after a deadline to reach a deal passed, leaving travelers around the world stranded and scrambling during the peak summer travel season.
Air Canada advises passengers not to go to the airport unless they have tickets on other airlines.
The strike could disrupt travel plans for more than 100,000 passengers.
More than 100,000 passengers from across the world have been left stranded after Air Canada's staff strike over pay.
Air Canada's planes are grounded after more than 10,000 Air Canada flight attendants walked off the job after a deadline to reach a deal passed
The employees are demanding, in part, wage parity with smaller domestic airlines, a union spokesman said. More than 600 flights have been canceled.
Ahead of the work stoppage, the airline said it had canceled most of the 700 flights that it directly operates, which carry about 130,000 people each day.
Air Canada cancels all mainline flights as over 10,000 flight attendants strike, stranding passengers worldwide and affecting 130,000 daily amid stalled contract talks.
Over 10K Air Canada flight attendants strike, grounding flights and limiting rebooking as experts urge travellers to prep backups, check insurance, and expect delays.

Passengers around the world are feeling the effects after the union representing more than 10,000 flight attendants with Air Canada announced its members were walking off the job after it was unable to reach an eleventh-hour deal with the airline. The strike officially began just before 1 a.m. ET on

You were planning to catch a flight and the dreaded text pops up on your phone: your flight has been cancelled. Now what? More than 10,000 Air Canada flight attendants are off the job after a strike deadline passed Saturday without a deal. The airline had already cancelled 500 flights on Friday in a
titles: Air Canada suspends operations as flight attendants go on strike
What to know as Air Canada grounds flights and attendants strike
Hundreds of flights grounded as Air Canada cabin staff go on strike
Air Canada suspends flights after cabin staff go on strike
Air Canada suspends operations as flight attendants go on strike
Air Canada cancels hundreds of flights as attendants go on strike
Air Canada’s Flight Attendants Begin Strike, Crippling the Airline

summary: Air Canada's 10,500 flight attendants initiated a strike on Saturday, leading to the cancellation of over 600 flights and affecting around 130,000 passengers daily during the holiday peak season. This action came after failed wage negotiations between the airline and the union, which sought parity with smaller domestic airlines. The strike began just before 1 a.m. ET, impacting all Air Canada and Air Canada Rouge flights.

snippets: Erin strengthened into a powerful Category 4 hurricane in the Caribbean on Saturday and continues to intensify, the National Hurricane Center said.
Erin is the Atlantic season's first hurricane and is set to escalate over the weekend though the threat of direct impacts in the Bahamas and along the east coast of the US appears to be receding.

Hurricane Erin gained strength Friday as it churned in the Atlantic Ocean and bore down on the Caribbean, where it could bring heavy rain to the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico.

summary: Hurricane Erin has intensified to become the first major hurricane of 2025. The storm is currently located in the Atlantic Ocean and is heading towards the Caribbean. It is expected to bring heavy rainfall to the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico.

title: Trump-Putin Talks in Alaska End Without Ukraine Ceasefire Agreement
snippets: Three BBC correspondents at the meeting in Alaska assess what we learned about the two leaders and what's next for the war.
The anticipated meeting between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin ended without a ceasefire deal in Ukraine.
Warm welcome for Russia's Putin at meeting with US President Donald Trump in Alaska, but no deal on ending Ukraine war.
Truncated talks end without ceasefire despite US president’s warm welcome for Russian leader
An immediate ceasefire to the war in Ukraine had long been a bedrock demand by the U.S., Ukraine and their European allies.
President Trump’s failure to reach an accord on Ukraine only made his warm welcome for the Russian leader more striking.

President Trump gave President Vladimir Putin a warm public reception, effectively ending his diplomatic isolation over the past three years for his invasion of Ukraine. But Mr. Putin did not agree to stop the war.
titles: No ceasefire, no deal: What summit means for Trump, Putin and Ukraine
Trump-Putin summit ends with no ceasefire deal

summary: President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin met at a military base outside Anchorage, Alaska, where they discussed the ongoing war in Ukraine. Despite a warm welcome from Trump, the talks concluded without reaching a ceasefire or any agreement to end the conflict. The meeting ended Trump's diplomatic isolation of Putin over the Ukraine invasion but failed to produce a solid outcome on stopping the war. Additionally, Trump spoke with Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky, who plans to visit Washington. The lack of a decisive agreement on Ukraine was noted as a significant aspect of th

title: Cloudburst in Pakistan and India Causes Flash Floods, 185 Dead
snippets: The majority of deaths were recorded in Pakistan's mountainous Khyber Pakhtunkhwa area.
Rescue efforts intensify in flood-hit villages as thousands remain stranded and death toll rises across Pakistan.

Floods triggered by cloudbursts and monsoon rains have killed around 400 people, with many more still missing, officials say. Rescue workers are desperately searching for survivors among the muddy debris.
The country has endured heavier rain during monsoon seasons, which scientists have attributed to climate change. The authorities said that at least 194 people died on Friday.
titles: Flash floods kill more than 300 in Pakistan and Pakistan-administered Kashmir
Flash floods wreak havoc in northern Pakistan
Flash floods kill hundreds in Pakistan, India
Flash Floods in Pakistan Kill at Least 150 People in a Single Day
summary: A massive cloudburst in north-west Pakistan has resulted in flash floods, killing at least 157 people, with the majority of fatalities occurring in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa area. The incident also caused deadly flooding and landslides in neighboring India. Rescue operations are ongoing for those still missing. The region has experienced heavier monsoon rains, which scientists link to climate change. The total death toll reported by authorities on Friday reached at least 185.

title: Trump Shifts to Seek Peace in Ukraine After Putin Talks, Ditching Ceasefire Plan
snippets: Trump changes his position on Ukraine saying he prefers peace accord as opposed to ceasefire after Alaska talks.

Ukrainian president to make first return to White House since infamous row with Trump in February

This comes as the Ukrainian President plans a return visit to the White House, marking his first since a notable disagreement with Trump in February. Trump's new position emphasizes seeking a comprehensive resolution to Russia's war with Ukraine.

Additionally, he achieved his first career stolen base during the same inning, highlighting a standout game that significantly contributed to the team's success on that day.

title: ASU Develops NasRED: Rapid Test Detects COVID, Ebola, HIV from a Blood Drop

This innovative test, which requires just a single drop of blood, utilizes gold nanoparticles to identify tiny disease markers, providing results in as little as 15 minutes.

The night was also notable for an incident of a player reporting racial abuse.

title: Bryozoans in Mediterranean Threatened by Acidification and Warming
snippets: Mediterranean bryozoans, including the “false coral,” are showing alarming changes in structure and microbiomes under acidification and warming. Field studies at volcanic CO₂ vents reveal that these stressors combined sharply reduce survival, posing risks to marine ecosystems.
titles: The ocean’s fragile fortresses are crumbling under climate pressure
summary: Field studies in the Mediterranean have found that bryozoans, known as "false coral," are experiencing significant changes in structure and microbiomes due to acidification and warming. Research conducted at volcanic CO₂ vents indicates that these environmental stressors drastically lower the survival rates of bryozoans, which could pose serious risks to marine ecosystems.

titles: Topological spin textures: Scientists use micro-structured materials to control light propagation
summary: Researchers have discovered that topological spin textures, specifically skyrmionic textures, are highly beneficial for advancing spintronics and quantum technologies. These textures, patterns related to particles' intrinsic angular momentum, are two-dimensional and have been the focus of extensive study for their potential to enhance technology in these fields.

title: Study: Adjusting Walking Style Eases Osteoarthritis Pain, Matches Medication
snippets: A groundbreaking study has found that a simple change in walking style can ease osteoarthritis pain as effectively as medication—without the side effects. By adjusting foot angle, participants reduced knee stress, slowed cartilage damage, and maintained the change for over a year.
titles: One small walking adjustment could delay knee surgery for years
summary: A study revealed that adjusting the walking style by changing foot angle can significantly alleviate osteoarthritis pain, matching the effectiveness of medication but without adverse effects. Participants experienced reduced knee stress and slower cartilage damage, maintaining these improvements for more than a year.
